Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The incidence of subependymal cysts in infants exposed to cocaine prenatally was 44 % ( 8 of 18 ) compared with 8 % ( 8 of 99 ) in the unexposed group ( p < 0 . 01 ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| subependymal cysts |
| cocaine prenatally |
| unexposed |

Note: "subependymal cysts" and "cocaine prenatally" are both considered diseases in this context, as they are both related to the developmental issues in infants exposed to cocaine during fetal development. "Unexposed" is not a disease, but rather a term used to describe the control group in the study.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| subependymal cysts |

The entity "cocaine prenatally" does not clearly refer to a disease, as it is a term describing exposure to cocaine during fetal development, rather than a disease itself.

The entity "unexposed" is not a disease, but rather a term used to describe the control group in the study.

Therefore, the only valid disease entity in the given paragraph is "subependymal cysts".
